description:
This place is a small business. A corner pizza gem. If you're ordering for takeout, they'll benefit more if you make your order through the phone. I made the mistake of ordering through Yelp for pick up, but I'll always call them from now on.

The energy, and the friendliness is worth more than the convenience of taking a couple buttons.
author: Mer D.

description:
Worthy. The salad was lovely. The wings average - I did take out so tossed with sauce myself. Good hot sauce (but not too crazy hot). Breading on wings a bit odd. Wings cooked through though 

Pizza?  Thin crust good.  BBQ sauce only average. They followed requests perfectly. 
Maybe try another pizza mix next time. Good service.
author: K H.

description:
Wasn't seeing anyone else mentioning one of the most amazing things about Katani Pizza, and their wonderful owner Katerina... GLUTEN-FREE Pizza that doesn't taste like.... you know.  Katerina flies in special crusts from out of state, and keeps them separate and non-cross contaminated from the regular pizzas. I'm from Brooklyn, and very picky about pizza, but this is by far the best gluten free pizza i've had.

The "gluten free" pizza from that other more well known place makes the crusts on the same countertops with the regular pizza, and I always get sick afterwards. Katerina cares enough to take it seriously, and she even delivered our first order herself, after we talked on the phone about her process. Always delivered piping hot within 45 minutes. Not going anywhere else. :D
author: Ian B.

description:
A small but cheery railroad space is nicely decorated, organized and so very *clean. You've rarely seen such a tidy little pizzeria. 

Onto the pizza, the main event: I was starving so I went right for the pizza with all the **meat! 

And if you love bacon, sausage, pepperoni and even sliced hot dogs, get the We Will Rock You- you'll be in heaven. It was absolutely delicious and very rich so there were plenty of leftovers. 

Trust me, I'm not complaining but the slice was groaning under the weight of all the pork goodness so I grabbed a fork to eat it lest I be wearing it. 

It was a fine concession. 

The salad was delicious with finely chopped (maybe it was shaved) broccoli on a bed of arugula, slivered apple and almonds, pancetta (pork!) and small pieces of cheese. 

And that my 10 year-old would be fighting me for the salad fork made me laugh: The salad was that good. 

Even at 4:30 pm, the pizzeria was starting to pop with people picking up individual slices and the delivery guy heading out with a pie.

I couldn't tell if the crust wasn't as crisp as I'd prefer or it was protesting the punishing weight of pork goodness weighing it down. The question didn't affect the star rating one bit, it's a solid 5-star spot.

And it's not just for take-out: Despite its small space, Katani has a serviceable amount of seating. 

If you're walking from Golden Gate Park two blocks away or deciding you can skip those next two 21-Hayes busses going by, you can comfortably unwind with a slice & a soda.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I just found out about this place on Grubhub and WHAT A TREAT!  So tasty and definitely a place I will try again and again.  Was pleased to see its in the old Pandhandle Pizza location on Hayes (which I used to go to many MANY years ago.)

Weirdly, I just drove past the location  the other day and felt a bit sad that Panhandle was no longer there.  The sadness has dissipated now that I know this delicious Katani pizza is there :)  We ordered there "Take a Chance On Me" pizza which was awesome and I'm very excited to try more.  I love that it's a small, privately run place too!  Try this place- really good (and I'm from Chicago so I know good pizza :)
author: Bianca G.

description: Quick fresh and really yum. We had the pizza with bacon and cheese that was good - not huge though. The poppers were amazing! We asked for the less spicy option without seeds. It was still hot but really good! The med salad was huge and really fresh but I would advise getting extra dressing. Or trying to mix it up a bit before.
author: Rosemary C.

description:
Excellent food and attention to detail.  My boyfriend has severe gluten allergies and misses common tasty foods, like pizza.  There are places that claim to have gluten free pizza, but that's all mute and void when the dough gets cross contaminated by being created on the same table with the same tools, etc.

When I called in, the owner Katerina picked up.  I told her about my concerns.  She is very meticulous about her gluten free pizzas.  They are made in Vegas, then frozen and shrunk wrapped to her store.  She has no tolerance for employees who don't take the "gluten free" part seriously.  SHE HAND DELIVERED OUR GLUTEN FREE PIZZAS TO OUR DOOR just to make sure they were done properly.  

I tried her chicken wings and they are equally delicious, breaded and baked with little bits of celery and carrot for taste.  I did not use the spicy sauce as I like it mild, but all of it tastes wonderful!!!

Definitely give Katani Pizza a try, they really care about their customers and do a great job delivering delicious pizzas: gluten free and with gluten depending on your tastes! :D
author: Elaine H.

description: Ordered from Grubhub and wasn't receiving updates, so I called. This is an owner who really cares. She spoke with me about my order, knew its status and apologized for the lack of communication from the Grubhub app--even though it wasn't her fault. Highly recommend the gluten free option. Will definitely continue going ordering from Katani Pizza for its excellent gf pizza and dedicated owner.
author: Jennie S.

description:
For your typical privately owned mini Pizza shop it's amazing. They have a wide variety of choices and you have lots of options to customize your own pizza. 

I will say though it's a bit on the pricer side, then again most privately own shops usually are $$. 

If you're a college student and provide your student ID you can get 10% off. The pizza's are made with care and it shows, nice and cheesy on a fresh backed thin crust. If you're in the area, I recommend you give it a try.
author: Yuriy T.

description:
Owner personally delivered.  Apparently, grub hub faxed the order 30 minutes after I placed the order.  The owner rushed the order over and was super apologetic. The food wasn't late.  Appears the grub hub people are hurting her delivery times.  Keep that in mind.  

It's not the owner's fault.  She received the order in 30 minutes and had it at my door.

The food was delicious.  The thin crust pizza was amazing.  The salads were perfect.

Keep supporting this place and don't fault the owner of the delivery times a bit long! It's worth the wait for some kind grinds
author: Logan Q.

description: Totally overpriced expensive Margarita. Pizza was served room tempurature as if it was sitting out for over 25min. It was not sitting in the oven but in the box and not in those insulated bags/purses to keep them warm. Grabbed a slice right away upon receipt and it was room tempurature and I love my pizza hot/very warm so that was the major killer of the overall experience. Sauce had close to no flavor but the excellent news is the owner states that no sugar is included this is very good. Dough tasted bland and lacked minimal salt in my opinion. People at the counter are overly flattering- FELT fake and disingenuous in my opinion. If the owner is sincere and genuine, good. Place has good potential though.
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
Tuesday, March 14th, 2017. Pi Day.

I had dessert pies earlier at work in celebration of 3.14 day. When the roommate asked me what I wanted for dinner, I figured we should keep the theme going. Decided to try Katani Pizza. We placed an order for delivery through Eat24 at 5:46pm. Our order arrived at 6:23pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Chicken Wings: 6 pcs, spicy ($7)
*We Will Rock You Pizza: Tomato sauce, light cheese, Italian sausage, pepperoni, salami, ground beef, bacon, hot dog, Thin Crust ($24 for 14" Medium)
*San Francisco Pizza: Pesto sauce, mozzarella, prosciutto, parmesan, arugula, no almonds, Thin Crust ($15 for 9" Personal)

The roommate loves meat pizzas, so I ordered that one for him. The pizzas are thin crust, so not super substantial if you're a big eater. It was fine with me as I prefer a thin crust, but I think the roommate would have a liked a thicker crust. The We Will Rock You pizza had plenty of meaty toppings. I wasn't sure how the hot dog would fit in, but it worked. I adore pesto, so I got San Francisco pizza. I wanted it to have more pesto flavor, but overall, it was a good pizza. The parmesan is strong, so don't order this if you want a mellow cheese. Also, I wanted more fresh arugula as I like that contrast in texture. The chicken wings were huge. Definitely a lot of meat on those bones. Taste wise, they had a little heat, but they were a little mushy on the outside.

Good place if you like thin crust pizzas like me.
author: Elena N.

description:
Ho hum, another 5-star review for  this place.  My wife and I were looking for a new pizza place after we visited a record show at USF.  Katani came up on our Yelp search and we walked down the hill and found the place easily.  

The shop was extremely clean and everything on the menu looked good.  The owner waited on us and she was wonderful to talk to.  The menu was fun--the pies were all named after popular song lyrics--no pretension and she was patient while we decided on what to order.

After we ordered, she came over and  introduced herself and explained about how the pizzas were made and what made them different than other pizza places.  

I wasn't disappointed; the pizzas came to us out of the oven and were so good that neither my wife or I wanted to trade a slice of each other's pie!

Although we live in a different neighborhood, we will definitely be back.  The pizza was wonderful and there are lots of other options on the menu for us to try.  

We also have a new friend.  Thank you for your hospitality, Katerina!
author: Emily B.

description:
Great tasting pizza, they definitely use quality ingredients and care a lot about how they make their pizzas! 

My fav is the Purple Rain, they name their pizzas after songs, how creative! 

We had ours delivered and the crust was still crunchy not soggy at all. We also had a salad and it was full of different veggies, bell peppers, carrots, cheese, yummo!

Definitely recommend this pizza place, owners are great too. Super friendly and speaks passionately about pizzas.

Thanks for a great meal, kid friendly too.
author: S L.

description: Yummy eggplant sandwich and BBQ chicken pizza! Friendly and personable owner who delivered my order.
author: Lauren S.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in nopa. They are super friendly and the pizza sauce is actually zesty which most SF pizza places lack. The crust is thin, crispy on the outside and ever so slightly chewy on the inside. If you are looking fo pizza on divis or the height stop now and go to Katani... really no comparison.
author: Bryan P.

description:
I have had almost everything on their menu.  Their staff is great.  Their pizza combos are great.  Their Jalapeno Poppers are spicy and brilliant.  Their GF pizza can't be beat, and their toppings are too damn generous.  Anytime there is an issue with delivery they call me immediately and work it out.  Also their Mac N Cheese is amazing.
I find their Hunter pizza to be the best choice.  While added toppings are expensive, they pile them on.  I would say this is one of the best pizza places in SF
author: Patrick W.

description: Ordered delivery a few times and it's always a really good pizza.  Love the pesto pizzas the most, crust is thin and light.  Not a heavy pizza at all.  Super nice delivery people too.
author: Nedra D.

description:
Quick takeaway pizza on a Wednesday night, I called and they gave me a 15 minute wait time,  which was pretty accurate.  I picked up a piping hot pizza and the lady who rang me up asked if I was a teacher or a student,  unfortunately I am not but I really appreciate the effort to give me a discount.   Also she wished my grandmother well, that was very kind

San francisco pizza 
- thin crust absorbed the oil from the pesto and was buttery and delicious
-arugula was fresh
-almonds were fragrant and gave a nice crunch
-slices of parmesan had a strong taste
-ham was way too thick sliced and salty for a pizza,  I think thin prosciutto would be a way better substitute

Good pizza conveniently located near the hospital, sustenance for spending a long evening there
author: Tina A.

description: Excellent choice for salads, pizza, sandwiches & pasta! Katarina will take care of you with fresh organic ingredients and super friendly atmosphere-- Highly recommended! We'll be back to this gem near USF, hopefully soon.
author: Ellen F.

description:
This is Probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had. 
Order from here, you won't regret it!
author: Taylor C.

description:
Our local pizza spot has changed owners and they are making a great first impression. As other reviewers have noted the owner is really invested in making a good customer experience for everyone - very welcoming.

First thing we had to try were the jalapeño poppers. I love the non-breaded take on this classic app. They are spicy too (like they should be).

The menu has lots of non traditional pizza, which I'm not really into. The idea of salmon or hot dogs on pizza is a turn off - so I just ordered my usual. Toppings and sauce were great. Crust is a little bleached white and floppy, but still good.

Will return to explore other parts of the menu.
author: Ross H.

description:
A true locals pizza place, on a half-block of other locals businesses.  Katani is located a block from the Panhandle, but it feels like a long way from there.  It feels like a place where flatdwellers walk over to sit at one of the 15 chairs and have a semi-quick dinner (pizza isn't a quickly made dinner, no matter where you go).

Their pizza menu is quirky.  Each combination is named after a pop song, a song that usually has nothing to do with the ingredients used but who cares about that.  Like the old Ike's Place, but Katani has a manageable number of combinations, and it's easy to pick out what you'd like, unlike the huge and unorganized menu of Ike's deli.

The Hunny and I had what I called the Queen Special  Actually "We Will Rock You", and I was surprised that my girl didn't start stomping her feet twice and clapping her hands once.  She made her own 9-incher with black olives and basil.  She found the basil too spicy once it kicked in;  her 10-year-old taste buds haven't grown to appreciate basil yet, I guess.  The Hunny and I were impressed with the meat-lovers pizza we had.  I especially liked the tangy salami.  Katani uses a thin crust, halfway between regular pizza and pita bread.  I'd rather have toppings than bread, so this worked great for me.

I love the owner, too.  She, like my girl's church friend, is from Bulgaria, so we got to talking (actually, she did most of the talking) about Bulgarian culture, Concord, her various businesses, the difference between the Orthodox Churches ("they're all the same"), marriage & family.  Friendly!

There are bigger pies available in North Beach if you want to gorge yourself.  They taste great too.  Katani can hold its own against them.  I don't think you can go wrong eating at Katani Pizza regularly.  They certainly deserve the business.
author: Ron L.

description: Sooo yummy! Got delivery for the first time from this place.  The owner delivered it herself and was super nice.  I ordered the chefs meat special (alfredo sauce, potatoes, bacon, jalapeños, mushrooms and garlic) pretty fing amazing.  Tried to save some for lunch the next day, but it didn't happen.  Just ate the whole pie in one sitting
author: Aletta A.

description: This place is great!  My 5 year old said it was the best cheese pizza she ever had, and the Katani pizza on thin crust cheese cornmeal was delicious.
author: Ashley + Kelvin Q.

description:
I'll keep this one short :)

Though I love pizzas (who doesn't) I've never had a good go-to pizza spot. Every time, I would always shop around, try something new, get disappointed, move the next one. 

Enter Katani. Since I discovered Katani I found my pizza spot. It's a no-brainer. Superb service, ultra clean, the pizza is not greasy, fresh, great meats, and the deliver ultra fast. 

They don't mind endless specific customizations (hey, no judgment!) and the wings are to die for. No customization is needed there - They're perfect.
author: Beckett C.

description:
In one word: ridiculous. The food and service were great.

I happened upon this place. Tried both the pizza and pasta. They were amazing. I highly recommend this place.
author: Alex G.

description: Best neighborhood pizza family style vibe hands down... Today Katerina (owner) was presenting new recipes of  pizza and pasta to add to her already fabulous menu... She hosted this free event all day everyone was welcome!
author: Nicolette H.

description: First time ordering through Yelp and it was a success. There was a coupon listed for $2 and free delivery which convinced me to choose this place over its competitors. We got the XL Katali special which is like a thin crust supreme. The pizza was flavorful and full of toppings. The pizza even tasted good reheated. Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Claudia A.

description: Great pizza. Thin crust and fresh ingredients. The owner is a wonderful lady who really cares about the quality of her product. Would recommend the jalapeño poppers too!
author: Dante Z.

description:
Had my daughter's birthday pizza party here. Katrina and staff were so accommodating to our party of 12!  So helpful!!!!! She had our pizza ready, table together, staff to help and personality to keep us coming back. This place knows customer service and how to engage with people. 

The pizza was our type. We are from the east coast and enjoy the thin crust pizza.  It's my new place to go to.  They deliver too. Killer. Check it out!
author: Valerie I.

description: The best pizza I had in the Bay Area. Ordered this today for dinner, first off the owner delivers the pizza and apologized for being late when the pizza came right on time. Also you can tell great care is put into the pizza and service. I'm definitely going back to Katani Pizza again. Thanks Katani for excellent service and amazing pizza!
author: Alex S.

description: One of the best pizza in the city! I've tried the "San Francisco" and the "Satisfaction". It's a tad expensive but totally worth it; after all this is San Francisco, what were you expecting? I usually go for the 14" which gives me the opportunity to have a second foodgasm for breakfast !
author: Mathieu F.

description:
The holy grail has been found.

Let me elaborate.

In 2012, while living in Alphabet City within the environs of NYC, I happened upon a legendary pizza place that my entire family goes to. 

Katani is the only place that has actually achieved the pizza of my dreams and memories in SF.

It's locally owned and the owners deliver the pizza themselves.  

Need I say more?
author: Priya S.

description: I love this pizza! I am a native New Yorker, and I truly appreciate this place. Finally found pizza I can be satisfied with in the bay. :)
author: Tina C.

description: Great pizza! My picky, 5 yr old son ate the entire thing. Even the crust! He's autistic, so the sheer magnitude of this is incredible. He is, by definition, a creature of habit. So for him to do something out of character is amazing, and a true testament of how delicious this pizza really is. I have a feeling this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
author: Monica F.

description:
when it's grub at first bite
it's aight to get cooked up in the hype
you got me starin at the fridge late at nite
i got you texting up your grrrls for insight

that's aight bc i baked it just rite
you got cheese so i can't leave mozz when i bite
can't go to your kitchen n nomersate late at nite
but i know you taste of me when food's orderin tite

SO I GO INTO this closet of a pizzeria and get handed a fun af menu by dope super friendly euro accent woman owner.

holup. blonde? glasses? *and* runs her own pizza place? that's like literally everything on my 3-item checklist of what i look for in a woman.

so who came up with the sick pizza combos?

"my wife."

(ddayyyyyyyyyyyyyymmm!)

and i wish i never pizzaaaaa at all
even tho cheese meat n dough
but she got grub for me
whoaaoooaaaoaaaaoo
but she still! belongs! to some chef else!

jjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjjk ;p ;p ;p ;p ;p

(^_^) Who Let The Dogs Out $16Med ()
hot dogs, pickles, ketchup, mustard

(^_^) Quinoa Muffins $9 ()
interesting non-standard fare

gonna need multiple trips to try their funkyfresh pizzas.

this place is small but hegga ill. #word

one tater 2top table outside.
author: Dan B.

description: do u crave for delicious pizza?guess what! Katani pizza is a bomb..every time i crave for pizza i always order here.Portion is good and fresh and so tasteful..The owner is great too...come get your pizza now!
author: Jaceymarie M.

description:
I saw the hot dog pizza and I had to have it. I figured it would either be amazing or terrible but would be an experience either way. It was so delicious. This is the pizza of your junk food dreams. I'm convinced every pizza needs pickles now.

Also! We were the restaurant's first delivery. The owner herself delivered it and she was so sweet. Looking forward to more pizza!
author: Sahra M.

description: Delicious slices for a neighborhood pizza spot! Whether you go veggie or meat lover style named after hits from 80s & 90s songs, my wife & I were able to go half and half on a medium pie without an upcharge...It's clean, the staff are friendly, and the owner goes to great lengths that your stomachs leave happy and hearts full if you decide to walk over and eat in or get the pie for takeout. Mangia pizzaaaah
author: vince r.

description: I tried this place because of the awesome reviews.  Unfortunately my experience was not the greatest.  I started with a bite into a jalapeño popper.  They definitely leave the membrane and seed in I definitely have not bitten into anything that hot and I'm not a stranger to hot stuff but that totally burnt out my tastebuds.  The pizza was acceptable the crust was a touch soggy. The chicken wings were fatty.  The cheesecake probably would have been really good but it had a slight pickle tast unfortunately but the texture was right on
author: Michelle K.

description:
It's Katrina and her commitment to making genuinely great pizza with freshest ingredients and her personal touch in each aspect of pizza making. It's a process she has nailed down so well that makes Katani our favorite spot. It's not pretentious and it's direct to the heart. Just like Katrina's genuineness. 
Mushroom and onions. That's all I need. The sauce and cheese stand out even more with simplicity on top.
author: Kunal K.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. They are so real & friendly & love conversation. Their pizza is like HEAVEN. It gives me LIFE AHHHHHH. Sooooo yummy. Love this place. Recommend to everyone!!!!!!!!!
author: Ashley A.

description: Eh. Crust is mediocre, and the pizza wasn't too flavorful. Ordered the "I need a hero pizza" hoping for a semi-healthy and yummy Friday night dinner, and really weren't impressed.
author: Candace S.

description: Came here today to grab a quick snack after class and I wish I had discovered this place earlier! I love how clean and kitschy the interior is and the pizza itself not only is delicious but inexpensive! Students get a 10% discount, and you don't have to be a USF student to redeem it. I will be back!
author: Ryan M.

description: We only order delivery from Katani and it's a perfect experience every time. The dough is the right amount of crunch and chew, the ingredients taste fresh, and the combinations are unique. On occasion, you'll have the pleasure of receiving the pizza from the owner herself. The pride she takes in the pizza is evident and well-deserved. Definitely one of our favorites!
author: P D.

description: This is right in my neighborhood. The people are very nice. I got a slice of pizza. It was very under-done. I had to cook it for a long period of time after I took it home. Then it was good.
author: Beatrice C.

description: I am a vegetarian and their veg pizzas are yummy, fresh, delicious, and done right. The dough, the vegetables, the sauces, the cheeses are mixed well and the pizzas turn out delicious. I solely ask delivery and delivery does a great job. I keep coming back because there pizzas are better than most of SF pizza joints.
author: Romit P.

description:
Katani has the best pizza and pasta in the SF, and is owned by two of the kindest and best people in SF as well.  I am so happy they opened on my block.  Katrina's (one half of Katani) recipe for the crust is perfect and brought with her from Bulgaria.  My favorite pizza has a super thin cornmeal crust with potatoes, bacon, mushrooms, Gorgonzola, and jalapeños.

Just to give you a sense of the proprietors - I fractured my leg a few weeks ago, and the owners were immensely generous and walked my puppy for me several times a day for weeks (I live on a top floor walk up and it was impossible for me to get him out for walks).  I didn't even know them before this, they just saw me on the street on crutches and came to my rescue.  

Thank you Katrina and Anna for the friendship and the delicious pizza
author: Anthony C.

description:
Ordered gluten feee pizza with smoked salmon delivery. Pizza was cold when it arrived. Added toppings, yet it seems they were very skimpy with their portions, with just a couple pieces of salmon here and there.

But worst part was the crust. It literally tasted like and is as thin as a saltine cracker instead of pizza dough. This is not what I expected for a $25 pizza, which was only a medium size.

Blaze at stonestown charges half the price for slightly smaller pizza.


I'm really disappointed especially after reading the reviews. Going to have to make something else to eat now... not going to be anywhere near full or satisfied from this.
author: Eric C.

description:
Who let the dogs out pizza is sooo good! I basically crave it whenever I walk by. 

Wish some of the non pizza things were a little better but for a pizza place it's pretty awesome to have it in our neighborhood.
author: John-Mark I.

description:
Ive ordered from here a couple of times and love their gluten free pizza.
I just got one but it's very different than the past ones - maybe they changed how they make their crust, but it is not good (I had a slice but cant eat the rest).
author: Shira S.

description: Fresh. Great value for the price. Love it. Just wish they had a little wider delivery area but great thin crispy pizza.
author: Marky M.

description: Wonderful pizza and great way to support local businesses. The owner is so friendly (she's got the cutest accent) and the menu options are great! You can easily substitute one thing, which is what I do. I love the combinations they have on the menu so I don't have to do the make your own pizza toppings thing.
author: Ines R.

description: Best pizza delivery we've had in years! Amazing service, excellent food, really quick! The cornmeal crust is amazing! The Margherita and bbq Chicken were very good but the special combo was definitely the winner at our house.
author: Michael G.

description: The GLUTEN FREE pizza crust is nasty. Don't order this here. They charge like $22 for a pizza and the crust is so gross! Much better pizza elsewhere. 1 extra star for fast delivery but never again
author: L. B.

description:
If you can trust the review of a stranger. I highly recommend this place if you want a good pizza. Or if you're from ny and its been awhile since you had a good slice. This is your place. When I go. I just get cheese slices. Sure they have jazzed up slices. But to me. They do such a good job at the basic slice, i find it hard to try anything else. The business owner is very accomidating and if something isn't what you wanted, she will go to great length to make it right by you. Though I never had an issue. 
The decorum is modest, as pizzaria should be. Super nice interior just tells me i'm gonna pay a lot of money for beer, and the pizza.. and the  pizza is going to be pretentious... and okay.
Also bonus. They make each slice.. fresh and to order. Which is a nice effort in pizza by the slice and a difference you can taste.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Looking for a new pizza joint after a few disappointing experiences with my old choices.  Very satisfied!  The owner herself answered the phone to confirm my order and also gaurunteed that I would enjoy her chicken garlic pizza.  She was right. I loved it.  I also ordered a small thin crust plain cheese, as I always do when trying new places as a baseline.  I think I found my new go to pizza delivery place
author: Andrea B.

description: Love this place! They have an awesome menu with plenty of veggie options. My favorites are "Knockin On Heaven's Door" (4 high quality cheeses on Alfredo sauce - genius!) and "Take a Chance On Me"(potato, zucchini, roasted peppers and garlic on pesto), although, everything I've tried has been good, including the pasta. Today, I was in with a meat-eating friend and we got  half "Take a Chance" and half "It's my Life". Now, he is a fan too. Check this place out, ask the staff for recommendations. They are very helpful and fun, creating a great place to hang out and get some delicious food.
author: Katya V.

description: I have been searching for a good pizza place for over two years in SF. I enjoyed most of them, but this place is the best here in the bay area.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Ordered two pizza from Katani last night. Both were excellent!
Some of the best pizza I have had outside of NY, or Italy
author: Ken M.

description: (Note, I hardly write reviews but I felt compelled to cuz I totally dig this place) I discovered this place a few months ago and it instantly became my go-to pizza delivery in SF! They have fun creative recipes and I've been trying new pizza combos every other time but my favorite is the "take a chance on me" it has potato pesto and other veggies. The jalapeño bacon cream cheese appetizer is spot on! I get those every time. One time they left the seeds in the jalapeños and it was too hot but the next time I ordered I told them to make sure not to leave seeds and they were perfect again. The bacon adds an extra savory crunch. Mmmmm hits the spot! The staff are very accommodating and friendly. There's a charm I like about this place and I'm sure you will like it too :)
author: Chris R.

description:
Great food!
Wonderful people!
Everything you wish and more from a neighborhood pizzeria!!
author: Barak R.

description:
Ordered from 24hours and was surprised with the fast delivery of still hot pizzas! Even pasta was in almost ideal condition.
We had plain cheese, 4 cheese and Hawaiian - crust was thin, cheese really fresh (especially ricotta in 4 cheese) and my wife said that this is the first Hawaiian that she liked (usually it is only for me).
We also had Penne with shrimps and we reget that we ordered just one. Sundried tomatoes was really good in it.
author: Maxim B.

description:
Oh how I wanted to love Katani. We live just a few blocks away, so when I saw a new pizza place had opened up I was thrilled! There is little good pizza right in the area, and there are fewer things better in life than a hot pie.

We called in our order for 5 people and went to pick up. We showed up 10mins after it was supposed to be ready, and still had to wait another 10. The order came to over $100 for 3 pizzas, wings, and a salad. Seemed a bit pricey, but worth it if it's great pizza.

Let's start with the salad (which I had taken a photo) it was pretty pathetic and looked like something I could have thrown together in 2 min. The pizza was mediocre, and the margarita was pretty much just bread and tomato. The BBQ chicken pizza was the best one, and still not great.

I'm hoping they are still figuring it out because they are new. But I will not be returning.
author: Maggie H.

description: I discovered this place thanks to a party the owner hosted for the neighborhood over Labor Day Weekend.  She and her staff welcomed everyone warmly and served an impressive feast of pizza, pasta and snacks for all to share!  Everything I tried was delicious.  I'm so happy to have found Katani Pizza.  It's a neighborhood treasure.  :)
author: Kristina P.

description: BEST thin crust pizza in the area.   Love the cornmeal crust which arrives crispy and structured even with delivery.   Cheese to sauce ratio is perfectly  balanced with ample toppings spread all the way to the edges.   This is NOT you're sad normal soggy delivery pizza that has 3 olives and a nugget of sausage on each slice bound by a pail doughy crust.   Third delivery was consistent - will be the ONLY one now on.
author: kiki s.

description: Best pizza in the hood. Great service and tasty pies. My go to spot. Call them and order instead of using apps too. See you in a couple weeks Katani!
author: Zo M.

description: My new favorite place!! Found this pizza joint on Yelp and it changed my life!! Fresh ingredients and fun signature pizzas to choose from! A major plus is that they deliver to the Sunset!! The owner is incredibly friendly on the phone and takes the time to get to know her customers...My boyfriend and I will be making a personal visit to Katani Pizza soon :)
author: dominique F.

description: Ordered online the night before for lunch delivery for a meeting.  Delivery arrived on time.  We had sandwiches and salads which were hot and very good.  Didn't try the pizza, maybe next time.  Would definitely order again.
author: Steven B.

description:
I've been to the business for eat in and I've tried their crepes and a few different pizza combos and there are several unique specialty pizza combos worth trying if just for the thrill of having hot dog and pickles on a pie.

Ask for the banana and Nutella pizza. Definitely not on the menu, but if the owner is there she may make it for you. 

Their crepes are my personal favorite and that was unexpected. The owner convinced me to try one when they just opened and they made to order a mushroom, chicken and pesto crepe and it hit the spot. I've maybe had a few more. Maybe.

The owners are present and put a lot of excitement into a store visit. I liked popping in when I needed a quick bite and some customer service. Definitely no shortage on that.

I'm going to try delivery next. I'm hearing good things about it from the other reviewers here on yelp.
author: Daniel B.

description: Soooo much better than Pan Handle Pizza ever was!  Thank goodness we finally have a place to get good food in the neighborhood.  The gluten free crust was awesome!  Crispy and tasty.  The regular crust was also very, very good.  Fast service, friendly, nice people running the place.  Can't wait to try other menu items.
author: Christiane G.

description: Definitely 5 stars! I stopped by with friends tonight. We ordered "Knockin on the heaven's door" with 4 cheeses and the owner offered us to customize it with fresh tomatoes, garlic and the other half for non-vegetarians with bacon! It turned out sooo delicious! It's a great little spot with great staff and a super fun and welcoming owner! Also I found out that for for Valentine's Day they gonna have sweet pizza with strawberries and bananas, which sounds very intriguing! Can't wait to try it!
author: KR S.

description: I'm not really a pizza person - but I think this pizza place definitely deserves a great review. I've had pizza there (and to go) maybe 5 times total, and every single time I was amazed but quality and freshness. Highly recommended! Oh, and staff is really nice and fun too!
author: Inez K.

description:
4 stars for the food, but 5 stars for the excellent delivery service. My fiance and I ordered their chicken pizza with cornmeal crust. It was average as pizzas go, though having corn on the pizza was a yummy touch that I encourage sceptics to try.

But the cherry on top was the free slice of chocolate cake they gave us for delivering the pizza late. We hadn't even complained, but they knew it was out of the ordinary and wanted to apologize. That's great customer service. I would definitely order from them again.
author: Jackie S.

description: Very cool new pizza joint for this neighborhood. The pizza was great the crust was golden and delicious. We ended up getting two medium pizzas one veggie one pesto with meat both were very tasty. The owner was very attentive and takes a very hands-on approach with her customers. She kept checking in with us every few minutes to make sure we liked the food. :)
author: Jason P.

description:
I wasn't sure whether to go with 2 stars or 3 stars. I ordered from here a couple of weeks ago, and despite the pizza having tipped during delivery so that a quarter of the pizza had no cheese or toppings, I though it was decent pizza. We ordered again tonight, and the crust was just a soggy, floppy, cardboardy mess. It almost tasted frozen. Although the veggies were all fresh, the cheese tasted almost creamy, like there was some kind of white sauce mixed in with it, rather than just pure mozzarella. I might give this place one more try, but I'm not holding my breath. 

Being an East coast transplant, I've been on a quest for a decade to find perfect pizza (or at least adequate pizza) here in San Francisco. I have yet to find it.
author: Amy B.

description: First time ordering delivery from here, and it was the best delivery  pizza I've had in SF. If you like thin crust NY style pizza with flavorful tomato sauce, and not overly goopy cheese, this is it. The veggie pizza was not soggy like it can often be with delivery.  I can't wait to go eat in the restaurant. I'm so happy - been in SF for 20+ years and I've finally found a NY style pizza that I love. This will be my go-to delivery pizza joint from now on. Thank you!! Yay!
author: V S.

description:
I really enjoyed this thin crust.  The menu is trying to be creative and unique, which I personally like.  Ordered delivery and and arrived in under an hour.  

I will definitely be ordering from here again.
author: M J.

description: What a disappointment.  Crust is thin but also grossly limp.  Order 3 different pizzas and jalapeños poppers.  The poppers may be best if eaten at restaurant.  Mine were delivered and not appetizing.  The pizza did not have flavor.  Almost like there was no sauce. Pasquale's and north beach are bettered delivered pizza.  Skip this place.
author: Donna M.

description: My new go-to pizza place. The pizza arrived 22 minutes (!!!!!!) after order was placed. The pizza was delicious! Very hot and the crust was crispy. The sauce is super garlicky (just the way I like it) and I got two medium pizzas (which are pretty big) for $44! I ordered from another local pizza place recently and paid $65 for a large and small pizza that paled in comparison. Perfect experience ordering delivery from Katani Pizza.
author: Annette B.

description: This place is really something special. First time visiting SF and stumbled upon Katani Pizza walking down GG park. Katarina is the sweetest owner ever and the pizzas are divine. Thank you!!!
author: Derick M.

description: FINALLY!! I've been waiting to find pizza this good since I moved to the west coast. Simple, quality, traditional east coast style pizza. If you're from the east coast, you know what I mean when I say good NY pizza is hard to find in SF. If you're not from the east coast, you must try this pizza and enjoy the thin crispy crust, salty fresh cheese, simple authentic sauce, and fresh toppings. Came out fast & hot. My new go-to.
author: Victoria V.

description:
Honestly I enjoyed their version of jalapeno poppers

However they have the worst Fettucine Alfredo I have ever tasted.  It arrived completely dry even though I had requested extra sauce.  Luckily I was able to whip up a sauce at home to make it edible.
author: Patrick N.

description: Absolutely fabulous!!! Katani Pizza is one delicious place:) Great food and wonderful staff. Bonus, they are open late. Whatever you will order, you cannot go wrong. From pizza to Katani salad...I have never been disappointed; in fact they have exceeded all my expectations. Highly recommend this place!
author: Peter S.

description: Found this place on a lark. REALLY GOOD tomato marinara with no added sugar. The thin crust used on the pies also does not have sugar in the recipe. Very important for my diabetic husband who misses the occasional pizza pie. The Owner lets us try an experimental slice on the House. Can't wait to come back and try something else.
author: Jenn B.

description: I was astonished how low quality the pizza was. It was like how I remember Domino's. Not impressed at all.
author: Rachel D.

description: I don't normally like pizza but I love the pizza here! Took a road trip to sf from la and I most definitely recommend this place. P.s the owner is the cutest
author: Adrianne P.

description: I tried Katani because it had 4+ stars. This is not accurate, in my opinion. The delivery guy was on time & totally fine. But.... I ordered a "Simply the Best" pizza with pepperoni, also chicken wings, and a caesar salad. All three items were terrible. The pizza was soggy & tasted weird - it had a metallic flavor & I couldn't eat it - I hate wasting food, but this ended up in the compost unfortunately. The salad was super basic - semi-wilted greens & dressing in a plastic packet. The wings were also soggy - seemed like they were store-bought frozen wings. I ate the wings because I was really hungry. The cost was $57 with tip - It was not even close to worth the price. I definitely won't order from Kitani again.
author: Matt W.

description: Finally, great simple pizza in SF! And the owner personally delivered. Ordering again for sure. Meatballs were great too.
author: Oliver L.

description: Delicious food for a good price, delivered on time all the times I've ordered on EAT24. Honestly can't ask for more! ::thumbs up::
author: Stephanie M.

description: Found my go to takeout pizza in SF. My bar is high being from NYC, and this is my favorite "cheap" slice in the city. Chewy crust, not too salty, generous heaping of toppings. Owner is sweet and full of energy.
author: Sasha Y.

description: Not the most amazing pizza but pretty darn good and dependable. Large cheese is $20 delivered and when we make special requests, they damn well take care of them. Not sure what else you need from the local pizza place.
author: Daniel E.

description: I rarely write any reviews but I really should for this pizza place because they deserve it. It's your local small business pizza restaurant where the owners and employees put their heart and mind in making very creative pizza combinations with perfect crispy golden crust. They cook their own homemade sauces for pastas and pizzas without adding any sugar. I usually like to come and enjoy their food inside the restaurant wth my family but I've also ordered many times for delivery and never got disappointed. The drivers deliver on time and sometimes even the owner delivers personally to make sure everything is okay and that I am happy. Even if I have to wait, it's worth it! Once I had to host a kids' bday party and needed 27 pizzas. Called in the restaurant to find out if they can deliver fast. Not only did they make those pizzas in a short period of time, but also helped me set-up everything for the party. I will be coming back to try all their pastas and pizzas on the menu and will definitely order for catering. Thank you so much for your hard work!
author: Victoria M.

description: Delicious pizza! Quality ingredients and my favorite crust in the city.  They've missed the service mark a couple of times recently  (late delivery, wrong toppings), but they are very apologetic and do their best to make up for it and make sure I have a pleasant experience. I can't recommend enough giving this neighborhood spot a try!
author: Steve M.

description:
I was intrigued with this place after it underwent a management change. Creative pizzas yes. Chewy cheese yes. Cornmeal crust yes...err uh well it was the option I selected but it is not what I got.
I'll prob give it one last shot..
author: Matt G.

description: Disappointing - Ordered delivery which took 1.5hrs and then delivered a cold, terrible, burnt basil, with NO fresh mozzarella on a margherita pizza - called to ask if I ordered it incorrectly which I did not and the person who answered was rude, bothered, and harsh with me! Unbelievable for that many stars.... would rather eat the burnt basil than eat their pizza!
author: Kelly A.

description: Owner is super friendly, it's like you're in her home. I've had the meat lasagna + penne with meatballs (delicious sauce). My almost three year old loves creating his own personal pizza. :) They're the only place I've found so far that has the option of hot dog as a pizza topping.
author: s t.

description: Great stuff! Got a regular cheese pizza for the kids and a Caesar salad for me. Delicious. And the delivery was awesome. Thanks!
author: Leake L.

description: Delicioso! After a round of disc golf and a long walk through GGP, pizza was needed. My friend and I got a Purple Rain pizza with pepperoni on it and it was yummy. We chatted with the owner for a while and she was super nice and funny. I noticed that there was a pizza with hot dogs and mustard on the menu, which sounds strange to me, so I asked her if many people order it. She insisted that we try it so she had someone make us a slice. We were pleasantly surprised that a pizza with hot dogs, ketchup, mustard, mushrooms, and baby pickles was so tasty. Perfect place for stoners to get creative and grub. I will definitely eat here here again next time I'm in the Bay Area. Muchas Gracias!
author: Erica C.

description: There was an accident outside the store, and the owner waited until it was clearing up to start our pizza so it wouldn't get cold.  She delivered it herself and I didn't mind the longer wait once it was explained!  (only about 15 mins later than expected) I was impressed by her foresight and customer service.  The pizza was unique and delicious!
author: Zoe G.

description: The thin crust pizza was just perfect and the bbq chicken wings just melted in the mouth. We got delivery and the owner delivered it to us herself, really great service and excellent food, would highly recommend them!
author: Deborah D.

description: Decided to try a new pizza restaurant based on the positive reviews. Extremely disappointed upon delivery (and delivery was over 30 minutes late from the guaranteed arrival time). Ordered a margherita pizza that arrived cold with no mozzarella cheese and burnt arugula. It was a cold pizza with just tomato sauce and tomatoes. Extremely disappointed. Ended up having to order another pizza from a different restaurant as this was inedible. Called to complain about the order and was told that they can't keep an eye on every pizza that goes out.
author: Allison S.

description: Came here to eat on a late night. Super awesome pizza place. Lots of variety to pick from. Love their chicken wings! The owner is super cool. Definitely the place to eat if you are around the area.
author: Fiona D.

description: Somebody brought pizza from this place to work and I dream about it ever since. I can't say anything about the vibes there because I've never been, but I ordered delivery and it was just as good I remembered it. Based on these reviews, I guess don't bother with the gluten free, but the regular old pizza is YUM.
author: Moonbird G.

description:
This is a very welcome addition to our neighborhood. The owner is very generous in her approach to establishing her new business. 
*The pizza is excellent, as are the crepes and salads!* the ingredients are very fresh and of superior quality.
After extensive refurbishment, it's very clean and up to date. You won't be disappointed!
author: James B.

description: This place is so delicious. They were also very quick and efficient when it came to delivery and ordering. My only complaint is how pricey it is but I think it was worth it.
author: Courtney J.

description: Really good service. I've tried several pizzas from here and loved them all, especially the white sauce one with broccoli. My friend and I picked up the pizza there tonight and I mentioned how I ordered a veggie one bc my friend doesnt eat meat. I said I liked chicken and the owner took the pizza back and put chicken on half for free! She also had dog treats for my frend's dog and water outside. Very friendly. Plus its easy to customize and order without calling if you are feeling especially lazy. I'm two blocks away so its great that there is finally a good pizza joint around. I really like the names of their pizzas too and the combinations are unique. They have also have gluten free options though I haven't tried them. I'll be back!
author: Lauren S.

description: Good pizza, I like the crust! The Greek salad was tasty as was the garlic bread. So glad to have them in the neighborhood!
author: Michelle G.

description:
Delivery was prompt and the food was still warm.
Eggplant parm sub: tastey but could have used more cheese and sauce, will probably order again
Meatball app: 3 small balls with lots of sauce and cheese (ended up putting some of it on the sub). Good but over priced
Cheesecake: delicious
author: JA C.

description: I really enjoyed this place! The pizza was delicious and the customer service was amazing! I tried the "It's My Life" pizza and the Katani Salad.
author: Edith G.

description: I got a Hawaiian pizza and the jalapeño poppers.  Pizza is good, nothing too special there.  Jalapeño poppers were pretty good, not as hot as they look!
author: Sean W.

description: Love it! Had my first pizza delivered and it is delicious, fresh, and crust is yummy. Since I live somewhat far in the Presidio, popped the pizza on a pan and had the oven crisp it back up again. Perfection. Will come again.
author: Alexis A.

description: good pizza and great owner, had a small pizza and four slices filled me up,leaving me four slices to become a late night snack.
author: Patrick H.

description:
Ordered the San Francisco pizza, and let me tell you.. it does not disappoint!! 

The staff were incredibly friendly. I got it to go, but the place seemed very clean :)
author: Emma G.

description: You gotta try their pasta. It's cooked to perfection. It had so much flavor. Every bite was like and explosion. They also have amazing pizza (the crust is amazing) and crepes. One of my favorite spots in town. They also offer fast and free delivery.
author: Clark L.

description: Pretty delicious! The cheese wasn't too greasy and didn't feel super unhealthy after scarfing it all down haha great pizza!!
author: Chelsey E.

description:
Updating to 5 stars. Ordered for delivery and it was fantastic. Had the meat lasagna.  The portions are huge so I got two meals out of it!

Really good! The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is I prefer my pizza crust a little crispier.  Next time I order I am going to ask for it a little crispier. We also had the spaghetti and meatballs and the cheese garlic bread. Both were delicious. Can't wait to work my way through the menu. Bonus, we ordered for pick up and it was ready in 15 minutes!
author: Hilary M.

description: We ordered a margarita pizza and chicken nuggets. The pizza lacked flavor and looked like they just threw a couple squares of mozzarella cheese slices onto the pie. The nuggets were burned and tasted like they were frozen without thawing first.
author: Joe J.

description: Really good pizza. No greasy, fresh crust and baked perfectly. Glad to have a good pizza place in this area finally!
author: Scott C.

description:
Ordered from Eat 24 after seeing strong reviews and my regular pizza joint was closed for the holidays.  Got large cornmeal crust with pepperoni and jalapeno plus garlic bread with cheese and spicy chicken wings.

The pizza had high potential...the crust was thinner than i expected as i'd ordered the regular cornmeal rather than the thin cornmeal but was tasty and well cooked and the pepperoni was very good.  The downsides were that the jalapeno was pretty much raw and the whole thing was delivered at a tepid temperature.  It was the owner that delivered it...it seemed she was short staffed due to the holidays...so perhaps she was trying to do lots of orders in one run but the pizza definitely did not benefit from being less than fresh and hot from the oven.

The garlic bread was meh.  A french roll, split, garlic and cheese added and toasted a little...bit it had no character.  It was just filler...like home made when you don't have time to do it well.

The chicken wings also suffered from being delivered at a tepid temperature.  Any fry crisp they had was soggy and they were definitely not spicy.

I really wanted to like this place and the pizza was solid enough that I'll probably give then another go...they just need to speed up their store-to-house delivery time to ensure the pizza arrives in top notch condition and they need to up their garlic bread game considerably.
author: Adam S.

description:
Just wow...
1. 45 minutes late.
2. The large pizza was cold and the size of a medium.
3. For a four cheese pizza, there was hardly any cheese.
4. Ordered extra toppings: basil=11 small pieces & sun dried tomatoes= 9 pieces.
5. Almost 50 bucks, including tip...avoid this place.
Never again.
author: S. M.

description: get the San Francisco or the Knockin' on Heaven's Door, you'll be happy.  The people are also really nice.
author: Richard F.

description: Absolutely great place , atmosphere is nice the food is amazing and the staff are very helpful and despite it being very busy and the pizzas being huge , we didn't have to  wait long to get our food  . It's simple to find and get to . Overall 10/10
author: Debra E.

description: Excellent fresh pizzas. Not greasy like most pizzas. Tomato sauce fresh and homemade. Had the 18in. More than enough for supper and cold for lunch the next day
author: Charles A.

description: This is the best pizza I've had in a long time . It was cooked to perfection and the owners are very friendly ! Great customer service! They make their own dough and sauces!! Perfection!!!! I'm coming back every week!!!!!
author: Jennie M.

description:
Delivery: Early/On time 
Taste: Tasted like nothing, the ingredients on their own were fine, just O.K.
The dough was very dry and thin, burnt as well

Don't waste your money on this place just on account of good reviews
author: Emil M.

description: Wanted to give more stars but pizza arrived nearly an hour late, by which time the veggie was cold and the crust was cardboard. Meanwhile our son said the cheese tasted like Dominos. Was surprised after all the good reviews on Yelp, so maybe just an overly busy a Friday night???
author: Kristy H.

description: We ordered pizza from Katani tonight for the first time! I decided to give it a try given the few reviews were all very good and as a new business with 5 star reviews, I wanted to show support. I am glad I did! The owner called to check the order, she even delivered it. She was courteous, polite and throwing her passion into this business!! We will definitely order from Katani Pizza again!
author: Emma B.

description: Great pizza, we got the take a "chance on me" pizza and "it's my life" pizza, also the "katani" salad was great, very simple but pact with flavor. The costumer service is awesome, and very attentive. Pizza came out in a timely manner.
author: Lucy G.

description: I found this place on my way from a walk in Golden Gate Park. The owner is extremely nice, funny and the place has a very friendly ambience. I tried the meat lasagna while I was there and it was unbelievable!!!! Very generous portions and the fresh and quality ingredients they use makes the lasagna fantastic. I was pleasantly surprised that they deliver in my neighborhood in the Marina as well. My friends and I have found our new place for delivery for all the football and Warrior games. Great place to watch games. I love to go eat there as I felt so welcome the first time I went and it's always entertaining. Recommend "Take a chance on me" for vegetarians with potatoes, zucchini, garlic. It was savory and light at the same time! Another thing from the menu I can recommend is their salads. House loaded salad is what I usually get.
author: Peter E.

description: Last week I had ordered a pizza from this new pizza spot that my friends told me was good. Let's start off with just ordering process I was ordering for a party of about 15 people when I was graded on the phone it was a very professional easy-going individual who would obviously knew what they were talking about I had asked for some recommendations on what type of Pizzas they would recommend so that everyone can have a pizza of their liking.it was very appealing to me that these are just your ordinary pepperoni and combination pizzas. They came up with creative and funny names that really make the ordering process a little bit different and fun I was able to order five pizzas all with different varieties for all different people they had told me that the pizza would be delivered within 30 to 45 minutes. Sure enough 35 minutes later a driver had showed up with the pizzas. They were easy-going and willing to bring the pizza all the way inside to where I needed it. And let's just say how important it is that the pizza was still warm when I got it. I had a chance to try all five of the different pizzas and I have to say the taste was amazing definitely my new go to pizza!
author: Robert L.

description: Had such great pizza from this place! As a student at USF, it was so nice to be able to order pizza after a long night of studying in the library from a place so close to school. They offer a student discount as well. Definitely worthy of 5 stars!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Awesome pizza. No sugar in the dough, or the sauce. Top shelf ingredients and friendly staff who care that you enjoy your meal. Try the San Francisco pizza. I will be returning.
author: S R.

description: the food and the service was exceptional the pizza and ceasar was mouth watering i loved it every bit of it. it was all a work of divine art. i would most definitely come back for more
author: Abigail S.

description: Best pizza I have ever eaten (and I have eaten a lot of pizza).  The crust is thin and somehow almost melts in the mouth.  Fresh ingredients.  I can't remember the name of my pizza but it was a cheese pizza with arugula and broccoli.  Seriously delicious.
author: Lindsey P.

description: This is a refreshing new pizza place with some cool concoctions.  The menu has lots of options to keep me coming back over and over.  The only problem was it was so good I am walking out overstuffed as I couldn't stop eating!
author: Jim J.

description: This place is awesome. I have tasted few of the pizzas and you just can't go wrong. The menu is hilarious and the owners and staff are awesome. Looking forward to eating here a whole lot!!!
author: L T.

description: These guys just opened this week and I ate here for the first time last night.  Pizza was very good and the staff was super nice.  Jalapeño poppers were homemade and not fried.  They were great.  Looking forward to having a good and reliable pizza place in the neighborhood!
author: Will H.
